section.title: Downloading Jmol
section.p: The current official release is version $VERSION$.

It can be downloaded from SourceForge using the following link:
jmol v$VERSION$
Some prerelease tests versions are also available from time-to-time at the same place.
Information about binary packages for Linux can be found in Jmol's Wiki.

section.title: Subversion Access
section.p: You can browse the latest source code online or anonymously checkout the project contained in the Subversion (SVN) repository.
To checkout the source code use the following command:
This will check out to the Jmol subdirectory on your system.

You can update the source code from withing your Jmol sandbox by saying:
svn update

section.title: Requirements
section.p: The Jmol web browser applet runs on most browser Java Virtual Machines, including the Microsoft and Netscape 4.7* implementations of the Java 1.1 JVM.
If you are running Microsoft Internet Explorer on the Windows operating system you should upgrade to the Sun Java Virtual Machine by visiting www.java.com.

The standalone Jmol application requires Java 1.4 or higher. The latest
Java 2 Platform Standard Edition
is recommended.
